notesStmt.note: Shelomoh ben Avraham: inscribed, folio 1r.Former owners' notes, folio 2r.Doodles, folio 230v-231r.Censored by Dominico Irosolomitano, Italian censor (active in the last quarter of the 16th and first quarter of the 17th century): inscribed with his name, 1627 (folio 228r); see 61, and appendix § 62-74. Censored by Giovanni Domenico Carretto, Italian censor (active in the first quarter of the 17th century): inscribed with his name (folio 228v); see 100-101, and appendix § 80-84. Aless[andro] Scipione, 1597: inscribed, folio 228v.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Pesaḳim and Ḥidushim of Isaiah of Trani, the elder, on the treatises of Ḥulin, Halakhot ḳeṭanot , ῾Avodah zarah and Berakhot.

collation.p: 29 quires: 28 quires of 8 leaves each (folio 2-227), with the exception of no. 15 (of 10 leaves, folio 114-123), 1 quire of 4 leaves (folios 228-231). Quires marked with catchwords at the end.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian semi-cursive script of the 14th century.

decoDesc.decoNote: 211r Pen and ink decorated initial panel.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine title: 'Isaiah of Trani. Pesakim. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 26,914.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile his manuscript no. 23; his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum through Asher & Co. in October 1865 for £1,000 through Adolphus Asher (b. 1800, d. 1853), Berlin bookseller and dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153: inscribed (folio [233v]).
